items.content: CBS News is fact checking President Trump's 2026 State of the Union address.

items.title: Highlights from Trump's 2026 State of the Union speech
items.standfirst: President Trump defended his first year back in office in his 2026 State of the Union address, touting his record on immigration, the economy, tariffs and more.
items.content: President Trump defended his first year back in office in his 2026 State of the Union address, touting his record on immigration, the economy, tariffs and more.

items.content: Virginia Gov. Abigail Spanberger delivered the Democratic response to President Trump's State of the Union address Tuesday night as the party attempts to counter the president's message.

items.title: Full speech: Virginia Gov. Abigail Spanberger gives Democratic counter to Trump's State of the Union

items.content: Virginia Gov. Abigail Spanberger addressed the American people during the Democratic rebuttal to President Trump's State of the Union on Tuesday evening.

items.title: Trump awards Medal of Honor to 100-year-old veteran at State of the Union
items.standfirst: During the State of the Union address, President Trump awarded Royce Williams a Medal of Honor for his actions in a secret mission during the Korean War.
items.content: During the State of the Union address, President Trump awarded Royce Williams a Medal of Honor for his actions in a secret mission during the Korean War.

items.title: 3 charts highlight the affordability issues Americans worry about most
items.standfirst: President Trump touted his work during his first year back in office, saying, "inflation is plummeting, incomes are rising fast, the roaring economy is roaring like never before."
items.content: President Trump touted his work during his first year back in office, saying, "inflation is plummeting, incomes are rising fast, the roaring economy is roaring like never before."

items.title: Trump closes longest State of the Union speech on record
items.standfirst: President Trump reflected on 250 years of the U.S. and looked ahead to the future as he closed his 2026 State of the Union.
items.content: President Trump reflected on 250 years of the U.S. and looked ahead to the future as he closed his 2026 State of the Union.

items.title: Trump presents pilot in Venezuela operation with Medal of Honor
items.standfirst: President Trump presented Chief Warrant Officer Eric Slover with the Medal of Honor during his State of the Union address on Tuesday night. Slover was the pilot in the first helicopter that descended on Nicolás Maduro's military compound, the president said.
items.content: President Trump presented Chief Warrant Officer Eric Slover with the Medal of Honor during his State of the Union address on Tuesday night. Slover was the pilot in the first helicopter that descended on Nicolás Maduro's military compound, the president said.

items.title: Trump awards 100-year-old veteran with Medal of Honor, receives bipartisan ovation
items.standfirst: President Trump honored 100-year-old veteran E. Royce Williams, who served in World War II, Korea and Vietnam, with the Medal of Honor during his State of the Union address.
items.content: President Trump honored 100-year-old veteran E. Royce Williams, who served in World War II, Korea and Vietnam, with the Medal of Honor during his State of the Union address.

items.title: U.S. hockey goalie Connor Hellebuyck will receive Presidential Medal of Freedom
items.standfirst: Connor Hellebuyck stopped 41 of Team Canada's 42 shots in the Olympic gold medal match.
items.content: Connor Hellebuyck stopped 41 of Team Canada's 42 shots in the Olympic gold medal match.

items.title: Trump's speech is longest State of the Union address in recent history
items.standfirst: Speaking for approximately one hour and 48 minutes, President Trump beat his previous record for longest speech given to a joint session of Congress.
items.content: Speaking for approximately one hour and 48 minutes, President Trump beat his previous record for longest speech given to a joint session of Congress.(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)

items.content: Donald Trump has sparked uproar during his State of the Union address after asking lawmakers to prove loyalty to the US.

items.title: Trump welcomes man freed from Maduro captivity at State of the Union
items.standfirst: President Trump welcomed a man who had been held in captivity by the Maduro regime during his State of the Union Address on Tuesday night, surprising the man's niece who was in the audience.
items.content: President Trump welcomed a man who had been held in captivity by the Maduro regime during his State of the Union Address on Tuesday night, surprising the man's niece who was in the audience.

items.content: President Trump renewed his calls for voter ID and pointed to work requirements for identification in New York City while delivering his State of the Union Tuesday night.

items.content: President Trump blamed Democrats during his State of the Union for the partial government shutdown over funding for the Department of Homeland Security.

items.title: Lawmaker ejected during Trump’s State of the Union address

items.content: Democrat Al Green was ejected from US President Donald Trump’s State of the Union address over protest sign.

items.title: Trump praises Dell family for donation to Trump Accounts program
items.standfirst: During his State of the Union address on Tuesday, President Trump thanked Michael and Susan Dell for helping fund the new Trump Accounts program, which allows parents to open tax-free investment accounts for their children.
items.content: During his State of the Union address on Tuesday, President Trump thanked Michael and Susan Dell for helping fund the new Trump Accounts program, which allows parents to open tax-free investment accounts for their children.

items.title: Trump touts tariffs, calls Supreme Court ruling unfortunate as justices look on
items.standfirst: President Trump touted his tariffs during his State of the Union Tuesday night and slammed the Supreme Court ruling striking many of them down as "very unfortunate" as four of the justices sat in front of him.
items.content: President Trump touted his tariffs during his State of the Union Tuesday night and slammed the Supreme Court ruling striking many of them down as "very unfortunate" as four of the justices sat in front of him.

items.title: Trump introduces U.S. men's hockey team to SOTU, says Connor Hellebuyck will get Medal of Freedom
items.standfirst: President Trump welcomed the U.S. men's hockey team to his State of the Union address on Tuesday night. The team beat Canada 2-1 in overtime on Sunday to win its first Olympic gold medal since 1980. Mr. Trump said goalie Connor Hellebuyck will receive the Presidential Medal of Freedom.
items.content: President Trump welcomed the U.S. men's hockey team to his State of the Union address on Tuesday night. The team beat Canada 2-1 in overtime on Sunday to win its first Olympic gold medal since 1980. Mr. Trump said goalie Connor Hellebuyck will receive the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

items.title: Who will — and won't — be guests at the State of the Union address
items.standfirst: Invitees at Tuesday night's address by President Trump include the gold-medalist men's U.S. hockey team, while Democratic lawmakers have invited several Epstein survivors.
items.content: Invitees at Tuesday night's address by President Trump include the gold-medalist men's U.S. hockey team, while Democratic lawmakers have invited several Epstein survivors.(Image credit: Nathan Howard)

items.title: Speaker Mike Johnson calls for "patience" on economy: "You don't flip a switch"
items.standfirst: Hours before President Trump's State of the Union address, House Speaker Mike Johnson told CBS News the U.S. economy is on the right track — but inflation hasn't been "completely fixed yet."
items.content: Hours before President Trump's State of the Union address, House Speaker Mike Johnson told CBS News the U.S. economy is on the right track — but inflation hasn't been "completely fixed yet."

items.title: Johnson calls Democrats' boycott of Trump's State of the Union "detestable"
items.standfirst: "We play for one team," House Speaker Mike Johnson told "CBS Evening News" anchor Tony Dokoupil ahead of the State of the Union. "We're all for America."
items.content: "We play for one team," House Speaker Mike Johnson told "CBS Evening News" anchor Tony Dokoupil ahead of the State of the Union. "We're all for America."

clusters.title: Brazil floods and landslides kill at least 30 after record rainfall
clusters.neutral_headline: Floods and landslides in Brazil kill at least 30 after record rainfall
bullet_summary: Three firefighters recovered a man’s body from mud and rubble after landslides triggered by torrential rains killed 30 people in southeastern Brazil, authorities said Tuesday, with 39 still missing
Reported by France24, Guardian World, BBC World and others

items.title: Brazil floods and landslides kill at least 30 after record rainfall
items.standfirst: Three firefighters recovered a man’s body from mud and rubble after landslides triggered by torrential rains killed 30 people in southeastern Brazil, authorities said Tuesday, with 39 still missing. Rivers burst their banks in Minas Gerais state, inundating Juiz de Fora and Uba. More than 200 people were rescued.
items.content: Three firefighters recovered a man’s body from mud and rubble after landslides triggered by torrential rains killed 30 people in southeastern Brazil, authorities said Tuesday, with 39 still missing. Rivers burst their banks in Minas Gerais state, inundating Juiz de Fora and Uba. More than 200 people were rescued.

items.title: Floods and landslides in Brazil kill at least 30 after record rainfall
items.standfirst: Firefighters search for 39 people missing in debris after river burst and houses were swept awayThree firefighters pulled a man’s body from the mud amid the rubble of houses swept away in a landslide in south-eastern Brazil, where 30 people died and 39 were still missing on Tuesday after torrential rains.A river in the state of Minas Gerais burst its banks and streets became raging currents of brown water after an overnight downpour in a region that has seen record rain this month. Continue reading...
items.content: Firefighters search for 39 people missing in debris after river burst and houses were swept awayThree firefighters pulled a man’s body from the mud amid the rubble of houses swept away in a landslide in south-eastern Brazil, where 30 people died and 39 were still missing on Tuesday after torrential rains.A river in the state of Minas Gerais burst its banks and streets became raging currents of brown water after an overnight downpour in a region that has seen record rain this month. Continue reading...

items.title: Floods and landslides in Brazil kill at least 25
items.standfirst: Hundreds of people have been displaced and dozens are missing, with rescue operations still ongoing in Juiz de Fora.
items.content: Hundreds of people have been displaced and dozens are missing, with rescue operations still ongoing in Juiz de Fora.

items.title: At least 23 dead as heavy rains unleash floods in southeastern Brazil
items.standfirst: Search and rescue workers are looking for more than 40 people who remain missing as towns reel from torrential rainfall.
items.content: Search and rescue workers are looking for more than 40 people who remain missing as towns reel from torrential rainfall.

items.title: Why are American tourists stranded in Mexico? #world
items.standfirst: Retaliatory violence after a cartel leader’s death Violence flared across parts of western Mexico after Mexican forces killed Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, the leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel. The cartel responded with a wave of retaliatory attacks that included highway blockades, prison…

items.title: Video shows compound where Mexican cartel leader was killed
items.standfirst: New video shows the inside of the compound in Tapalpa, Mexico, where authorities located and killed drug cartel leader Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, also known as "El Mencho." NBC News’ George Solis reports on the state of the country amid the violence carried out by cartel members furious over the killing.

NBC News’ George Solis reports on the state of the country amid the violence carried out by cartel members furious over the killing.

items.title: Why was cartel leader El Mencho killed? #world
items.standfirst: How authorities tracked and killed a top cartel boss Mexican security forces located and killed Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes — widely known as El Mencho — during a high‑risk operation after a period of targeted surveillance. Officials say the breakthrough came when forces followed a romantic partner…

Officials say the breakthrough came when forces followed a romantic partner…

items.title: Mexico pledges safety for World Cup after violence erupts from cartel boss’s killing
items.standfirst: Mexico’s president says there is ‘no risk’ for those visiting for Fifa games after military killed drug lord ‘El Mencho’Violence in Mexico after military kills notorious drug cartel boss – a visual guideMexico’s president, Claudia Sheinbaum, has said that there is “no risk” for visitors coming to Fifa World Cup games scheduled to be held in the country, after the death of a top cartel boss triggered a wave of retaliatory violence from gunmen who blocked roads and attacked security forces across the country.The Mexican military attempted to detain “El Mencho”, the leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, in a dawn raid on Sunday, leading to a firefight in which he was fatally wounded, before dying while being airlifted to hospital. Continue reading...
items.content: Mexico’s president says there is ‘no risk’ for those visiting for Fifa games after military killed drug lord ‘El Mencho’Violence in Mexico after military kills notorious drug cartel boss – a visual guideMexico’s president, Claudia Sheinbaum, has said that there is “no risk” for visitors coming to Fifa World Cup games scheduled to be held in the country, after the death of a top cartel boss triggered a wave of retaliatory violence from gunmen who blocked roads and attacked security forces across the country.The Mexican military attempted to detain “El Mencho”, the leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, in a dawn raid on Sunday, leading to a firefight in which he was fatally wounded, before dying while being airlifted to hospital. Continue reading...

items.title: Why is Mexico in turmoil after El Mencho's death? #world
items.standfirst: Mexican security operations and cartel reprisals Mexican authorities killed Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, the long‑time leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG), during a high‑risk operation. That operation has set off waves of coordinated reprisals and unrest across multiple states as…
items.content: Mexican security operations and cartel reprisals Mexican authorities killed Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, the long‑time leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG), during a high‑risk operation. That operation has set off waves of coordinated reprisals and unrest across multiple states as…

items.content: Violence has erupted across several states in Mexico after cartel leader El Mencho was killed on Sunday.

items.title: Mexican drug cartel boss ‘El Mencho’ tracked through romantic partner
items.standfirst: Killing of Jalisco New Generation Cartel leader sparks wave of violence across western MexicoAnalysis: Mexico faces uphill battle to appease kingpin TrumpWho was El Mencho?Mexican authorities tracked down and killed “El Mencho”, one of the world’s most wanted drug traffickers, by following a romantic partner to his safe house near a picturesque mountain town, the country’s defence secretary has revealed.In a press conference, officials provided the first details about the operation that led to the death of the leader of Mexico’s most powerful organised crime group, the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG). Continue reading...
items.content: Killing of Jalisco New Generation Cartel leader sparks wave of violence across western MexicoAnalysis: Mexico faces uphill battle to appease kingpin TrumpWho was El Mencho?Mexican authorities tracked down and killed “El Mencho”, one of the world’s most wanted drug traffickers, by following a romantic partner to his safe house near a picturesque mountain town, the country’s defence secretary has revealed.In a press conference, officials provided the first details about the operation that led to the death of the leader of Mexico’s most powerful organised crime group, the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG). Continue reading...

clusters.title: Paris says US envoy pledges not to 'interfere' in France affairs
clusters.neutral_headline: US ambassador to France set for talks with foreign minister after row
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, BBC World, Guardian World and others

items.title: Paris says US envoy pledges not to 'interfere' in France affairs
items.standfirst: The US ambassador to Paris, Charles Kushner, called France's foreign minister Tuesday and pledged not to "interfere" in the host country's affairs, a diplomatic source said, after a fallout over Washington's remarks following the killing of a far-right activist. FRANCE 24's August Hakansson reports.
items.content: The US ambassador to Paris, Charles Kushner, called France's foreign minister Tuesday and pledged not to "interfere" in the host country's affairs, a diplomatic source said, after a fallout over Washington's remarks following the killing of a far-right activist. FRANCE 24's August Hakansson reports.

items.title: From prison to Paris: Ambassador Charles Kushner at the centre of a Franco-American rift
items.standfirst: US Ambassador to France Charles Kushner – a former felon and real-estate magnate aligned with US President Donald Trump – is at the centre of a diplomatic spat after failing to obey a foreign ministry summons, prompting France to restrict his access to government officials. Pardoned by Donald Trump in 2020, Kushner’s appointment has long drawn scrutiny for his criminal past and lack of diplomatic experience.
items.content: US Ambassador to France Charles Kushner – a former felon and real-estate magnate aligned with US President Donald Trump – is at the centre of a diplomatic spat after failing to obey a foreign ministry summons, prompting France to restrict his access to government officials. Pardoned by Donald Trump in 2020, Kushner’s appointment has long drawn scrutiny for his criminal past and lack of diplomatic experience.

items.title: US ambassador to France set for talks with foreign minister after row
items.standfirst: Charles Kushner has spoken to France's foreign minister after failing to respond to a summons on Monday.
items.content: Charles Kushner has spoken to France's foreign minister after failing to respond to a summons on Monday.

items.title: Kushner calls Barrot after fallout
items.standfirst: According to sources, the US envoy pledges not to 'interfere' in France affairs. François Picard speaks to Jeffrey Hawkins, former US ambassador to the Central African Republic and research fellow at IRIS.
items.content: According to sources, the US envoy pledges not to 'interfere' in France affairs. François Picard speaks to Jeffrey Hawkins, former US ambassador to the Central African Republic and research fellow at IRIS.

items.title: US ambassador to France vows not to interfere in its domestic affairs
items.standfirst: Charles Kushner, father of president’s son-in-law Jared, failed to show up to meeting to explain US comments relating to death of far-right activistDonald Trump’s envoy to Paris has called France’s foreign minister and pledged not to interfere in the country’s domestic affairs, a day after he was barred from talking to government officials for failing to attend a formal meeting at the ministry.The foreign ministry said on Monday that Charles Kushner would not be permitted to carry out his diplomatic duties until he had explained his refusal to comply with the summons over US comments about the killing of a far-right activist in France. Continue reading...
items.content: Charles Kushner, father of president’s son-in-law Jared, failed to show up to meeting to explain US comments relating to death of far-right activistDonald Trump’s envoy to Paris has called France’s foreign minister and pledged not to interfere in the country’s domestic affairs, a day after he was barred from talking to government officials for failing to attend a formal meeting at the ministry.The foreign ministry said on Monday that Charles Kushner would not be permitted to carry out his diplomatic duties until he had explained his refusal to comply with the summons over US comments about the killing of a far-right activist in France. Continue reading...

items.title: France demands U.S. Ambassador Charles Kushner explain no-show as Trump's diplomats anger Europe
items.standfirst: U.S. Ambassador Charles Kushner has been banned from meeting French officials after snubbing a meeting over comments about the death of far-right activist Quentin Deranque.
items.content: U.S. Ambassador Charles Kushner has been banned from meeting French officials after snubbing a meeting over comments about the death of far-right activist Quentin Deranque.

clusters.title: The Louvre Museum's director has resigned in the wake of October's brazen jewel heist
clusters.neutral_headline: Louvre president resigns as jewellery heist inquiry reveals ‘systemic failures’
bullet_summary: Reported by NPR News, Guardian World, France24

items.title: The Louvre Museum's director has resigned in the wake of October's brazen jewel heist
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron accepted Laurence des Cars' resignation as "an act of responsibility" at a moment when the Louvre needs security upgrades, modernization and other major projects.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron accepted Laurence des Cars' resignation as "an act of responsibility" at a moment when the Louvre needs security upgrades, modernization and other major projects.(Image credit: Emma Da Silva)

items.title: Louvre president resigns as jewellery heist inquiry reveals ‘systemic failures’
items.standfirst: Laurence des Cars steps down days after parliamentary inquiry called Paris museum a ‘state within a state’The president of the Louvre in Paris has resigned, four months after a gang of thieves broke into the museum’s Apollo gallery and made off with €88m (£76m) of Napoleonic jewellery in France’s most dramatic heist in decades.Laurence des Cars, who had offered to step down in the immediate aftermath of the burglary, tendered her resignation to Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday in what the French president called “an act of responsibility”, the Elysée Palace said. Continue reading...
items.content: Laurence des Cars steps down days after parliamentary inquiry called Paris museum a ‘state within a state’The president of the Louvre in Paris has resigned, four months after a gang of thieves broke into the museum’s Apollo gallery and made off with €88m (£76m) of Napoleonic jewellery in France’s most dramatic heist in decades.Laurence des Cars, who had offered to step down in the immediate aftermath of the burglary, tendered her resignation to Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday in what the French president called “an act of responsibility”, the Elysée Palace said. Continue reading...

items.title: Louvre director resigns after a series of high-profile setbacks for the museum
items.standfirst: Louvre museum director Laurence des Cars resigned on Tuesday after a series of setbacks for the world-renowned museum. A high-profile jewel heist in October raised questions about security lapses while labour strikes and reports that the building is falling into disrepair have led to calls for an overhaul of the famous landmark.
items.content: Louvre museum director Laurence des Cars resigned on Tuesday after a series of setbacks for the world-renowned museum. A high-profile jewel heist in October raised questions about security lapses while labour strikes and reports that the building is falling into disrepair have led to calls for an overhaul of the famous landmark.

Otherwise, you let him own the house. Continue reading...

items.title: Democrats refuse to stand for Trump as Al Green ejected over ‘apes’ protest sign
items.standfirst: Texas Democrat removed for holding ‘Black people aren’t apes’ sign as colleagues stay seated while Republicans cheerAs dozens of their colleagues boycotted Trump’s State of the Union address, several of the Democrats in the House chamber on Tuesday night made their opposition to the president’s remarks clear.Congressman Al Green was ejected from the speech almost immediately, marking the second year in a row he has been removed from the annual event. After being ordered out by House speaker Mike Johnson during last year’s speech for yelling responses as the president spoke, this year’s protest from the Texas representative was silent but pointed. Continue reading...
items.content: Texas Democrat removed for holding ‘Black people aren’t apes’ sign as colleagues stay seated while Republicans cheerAs dozens of their colleagues boycotted Trump’s State of the Union address, several of the Democrats in the House chamber on Tuesday night made their opposition to the president’s remarks clear.Congressman Al Green was ejected from the speech almost immediately, marking the second year in a row he has been removed from the annual event. After being ordered out by House speaker Mike Johnson during last year’s speech for yelling responses as the president spoke, this year’s protest from the Texas representative was silent but pointed. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump defends first-year record in State of the Union speech amid low approval ratings
items.standfirst: President brings in US men’s hockey team as surprise guests to bolster speech before November midtermsState of the Union address - live updatesSign up for the Breaking News US email to get newsletter alerts in your inboxDonald Trump proclaimed his first year in office a success at the State of the Union address on Tuesday evening, even as his presidency is dogged by low public approval ratings before November’s midterm elections in which voters could hand control of Congress back to his Democratic opponents.The annual address to a joint session of Congress came after months of turmoil for the Republican president, including a crackdown on immigrant communities in Minneapolis that resulted in the deaths of two US citizens, and faltering progress on his campaign promise of lowering the cost of living. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: Trump boasts 'turnaround for the ages' in State of the Union address
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump boasted Tuesday of a "turnaround for the ages" in a State of the Union speech, seeking to reverse his dismal polls and see off mounting challenges at home and abroad ahead of crucial midterm elections. Arriving to address a joint session of Congress, Trump was welcomed with cheers and a standing ovation from Republicans while Democrats remained seated in protest. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.
items.content: US President Donald Trump boasted Tuesday of a "turnaround for the ages" in a State of the Union speech, seeking to reverse his dismal polls and see off mounting challenges at home and abroad ahead of crucial midterm elections. Arriving to address a joint session of Congress, Trump was welcomed with cheers and a standing ovation from Republicans while Democrats remained seated in protest. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

items.title: Bodo/Glimt complete dream run with victory over Inter Milan in Champions League
items.standfirst: Norwegian side Bodo/Glimt reached the Champions League last 16 on Tuesday after a 2-1 win at Inter Milan secured a 5-2 aggregate victory, sealing the biggest result in the club’s history and setting up a tie with either Manchester City or Sporting Portugal.

bullet_summary: Reported by BBC Top Stories, Guardian World

items.title: Assisted dying on Welsh NHS a step closer as Senedd votes in favour
items.standfirst: In major vote Senedd backs legislation which could allow for terminally ill people to end their lives.
items.content: In major vote Senedd backs legislation which could allow for terminally ill people to end their lives.

items.title: Senedd votes in favour of implementing Westminster’s assisted dying bill
items.standfirst: Should legislation pass House of Lords, the matter will require another vote after May’s Welsh electionsWales’s Senedd has voted in favour of implementing Westminster’s assisted dying bill, overcoming a constitutionally awkward situation that could have forced terminally ill people who wish to end their lives to travel to England or seek private provision.In a debate stretching into Tuesday night in the Senedd’s newly expanded chamber, members voted 28 for and 23 against, with two abstentions. Should the legislation pass the House of Lords, the matter will require another Senedd vote after May’s Welsh elections. Continue reading...
items.content: Should legislation pass House of Lords, the matter will require another vote after May’s Welsh electionsWales’s Senedd has voted in favour of implementing Westminster’s assisted dying bill, overcoming a constitutionally awkward situation that could have forced terminally ill people who wish to end their lives to travel to England or seek private provision.In a debate stretching into Tuesday night in the Senedd’s newly expanded chamber, members voted 28 for and 23 against, with two abstentions. Should the legislation pass the House of Lords, the matter will require another Senedd vote after May’s Welsh elections. Continue reading...

clusters.title: South Africa secures release of more nationals lured to Ukraine war
clusters.neutral_headline: South Africa secures release of more nationals lured to Ukraine war
bullet_summary: Also, the military spokesperson for the M23 rebel group is reportedly killed in an army drone strike in eastern DR Congo
Reported by France24, BBC World

items.title: South Africa secures release of more nationals lured to Ukraine war
items.standfirst: In tonight's edition, President Cyril Ramaphosa thanks his counterpart Vladimir Putin for helping to secure the return of 11 South Africans tricked into joining the Russia-Ukraine war. Also, the military spokesperson for the M23 rebel group is reportedly killed in an army drone strike in eastern DR Congo. And more than 6 million people are on the brink of famine in Somalia as the country is facing widespread drought.
items.content: In tonight's edition, President Cyril Ramaphosa thanks his counterpart Vladimir Putin for helping to secure the return of 11 South Africans tricked into joining the Russia-Ukraine war. Also, the military spokesperson for the M23 rebel group is reportedly killed in an army drone strike in eastern DR Congo. And more than 6 million people are on the brink of famine in Somalia as the country is facing widespread drought.

items.title: Former U.K. ambassador to the U.S. arrested amid Epstein investigation
items.standfirst: British police have arrested Peter Mandelson, the former ambassador to the United States, following revelations about his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein. NBC News' Raf Sanchez has details on what the police are saying about their investigation into Mandelson's alleged misconduct in public office.

items.title: Ex-British ambassador to the U.S. released on bail after arrest in Epstein investigation
